page.title: 09Coastline and beaches
page.content: LANDSCAPE IN THE DELABOLE AREA. {Coastline and beaches. This stretch of{coastline}has recently (in geological terms) been uplifted and is therefore in the early stages of development.{Valleys}are short & steepsided.{Streams}tumble to the sea over rocks and waterfalls. {Beaches}are shallow,only accessible at low tide. The{rock}is mainly grey slate (with igneous intrusions) and the{sand}is greyish and coarse. It has been used in agriculture and the valley road from Trebarwith Strand is still called the "sanding road". {Coasting vessels}used Port William and Backways Cove to land coal. Now the beaches are{tourist}attractions, though only{Trebarwith Strand}is accessible by road. At{Tregardock}the landowner has deliberately kept access difficult,for conservation reasons.
